titleStmt.title: The compleat bee-master; or, A discourse of bees shewing the best way of improving them, and discovering the fallacies that are imposed by some, for private lucre, on the credulous lovers and admirers of these insects. By J. Worlidge, gent.
Apiarum; or A discourse of bees
titleStmt.author: Worlidge, John, fl. 1660-1698.

titleStmt.title: The compleat bee-master; or, A discourse of bees shewing the best way of improving them, and discovering the fallacies that are imposed by some, for private lucre, on the credulous lovers and admirers of these insects. By J. Worlidge, gent.
Apiarum; or A discourse of bees
titleStmt.author: Worlidge, John, fl. 1660-1698.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for, and sold by G. Conyers, at the Ring in Little-Britain,

notesStmt.note: Frontipiece plate of beehive beneath a fruit tree.
With two final advertisement leaves and contents on p. 28.
Another edition of John Worlidge's "Apiarum; or a discourse of bees", London, 1676, reissued with a cancel titlepage.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
